cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 120 miles SE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west, then west-northwest and turning northwest toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central Louisiana coast between Morgan City and Cameron

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Cameron, Louisiana
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from the Upper Texas coast eastward to Mississippi–Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Friday night into Saturday; a 32% chance of 50-kt (58-mph) winds with gusts potentially higher.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–6 ft of surge possible along the southwest Louisiana coast, including Calcasieu Pass and approaches to Lake Charles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches of rain with locally higher totals up to 20 inches possible, leading to flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding of low-lying terminals, possible tornadoes in outer rain bands, and prolonged drainage/overland flooding that could hamper ground transportation and port access.
